channel.title: Switching To Maya
channel.description:
Hello everyone, I would like to inform you all that I will be switching from Blender to Maya as I feel I've progressed as far as I wish to with a program that will get me nowhere post-secondary school. Why did I choose Autodesk Maya? Well, for one reason, Maya (as well as 3DS Max) is used by many major companies in the gaming/movie effects industry, which is where I plan to end up post-secondary. The reason I'm posting this is because I want you all to bare with me as I will be starting from scratch in order to learn a new program, so when I do feel that I'm ready to start posting my models, do not expect them to be at the level I was in Blender (although, the rendering quality will be a lot better as Blender only has mediocre rendering capabilities). Please note that for those of you who do use Blender, don't think that it is a bad program as it isn't. But if you have plans on going into the 3D modeling/animation industry you will need to switch programs and its better to do so sooner than later.
*EDIT* I know this doesn't have much to do with models itself, but as I am never in any other section of these forums, I felt it made no sense to post elsewhere.

http://excellent-downloads.net/shop/item/322/?cpn=webbyawards_oem_1

There ^^
I have seen the whole package of autodesk programs all for £198 ish, can’t find it now though.

item.title: Switching To Maya
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:17, topic:353702”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=450013.msg3303222#msg3303222 date=1281464664]

Jagex does not use there own program. They do use Maya, as do many gaming companies. Why would Jagex spend a shitload of money to create a custom program when Maya can do everything they want easily? At most, they use a customized version of Maya (or Lightwave, if they do use that as well). Heres an update guys: I wont be posting many models until September as in September I will be getting a high-end computer specifically for modeling. Intel i7 Quad core =D . Also, once September comes around I should have a fully licensed(and legal) version of Maya, 3DS Max, and a few other Autodesk programs whick I’ll need post secondary.

I hope you’re getting a good graphics card too, that’ll greatly affect render times.
ps. you didn’t answer, are you getting the student deal not the package which’ll cost thousands?
[/quote]
Sorry, I’m not sure which im getting. Probably the student deal seeing as if my parents see $1000 for it they’ll probabliy (literally) shit their pants; and yes, I’m getting a good graphics card.[/quote]

Good boy.
And uh, $1000?

autodesk.com

3ds Max Subscription | Buy 3ds Max 2019 Software | Autodesk

Subscribe to 3ds Max software for 3D modeling, animation, and rendering. Buy online or through a reseller. Subscribers get the latest updates.

$3,495, and that’s without Maya…

Read full topic

item.title: Switching To Maya
item.dc:creator: @Cowarooroo Cowarooroo
item.description:
@Cowarooroo wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:10, topic:353702”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=450013.msg3301966#msg3301966 date=1281374801]

good choice, but isn’t maya really expensive?

Yes, Maya is expensive but my parents have agreed to pay for both Maya and a new Quad core processor for my computer so I can actually USE a program properly. Right now my ability to model is VERY limited as my processor can’t support much of anything. Also, I chose Maya because I’m applying at the 6th best Art institute in N.America, which happens to be the only one placing in the top 50 that was Canadian. Wish me luck =D

Wait you pirated $3500 software but your going to buy it?

Did you pay the full price for the software, or did you get the student offer for non commercial and learning purposes?
Is a hell of a lot cheaper, you can get 3ds max, maya, and a couple of other autodesk programs all for £160 (about $250).

Will you be using 3ds max aswell? or just Maya?
I’ve heard Maya’s not great for rendering because you can’t get vray for it?

So many questions, aha, I wish you very good luck, and I shall be looking forward to seeing some good shit cause we all know you have an amazing talent already.
[/quote]
I mostlikely will be getting the whole AutoDesk set of programs. Already have 3DS on this comp and now Maya. Atm I have them Pirated but will be getting them legally once I get my new processor (and completely clean out my hard drive.)[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Switching To Maya
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

Hello everyone, I would like to inform you all that I will be switching from Blender to Maya as I feel I’ve progressed as far as I wish to with a program that will get me nowhere post-secondary school. Why did I choose Autodesk Maya? Well, for one reason, Maya (as well as 3DS Max) is used by many major companies in the gaming/movie effects industry, which is where I plan to end up post-secondary. The reason I’m posting this is because I want you all to bare with me as I will be starting from scratch in order to learn a new program, so when I do feel that I’m ready to start posting my models, do not expect them to be at the level I was in Blender (although, the rendering quality will be a lot better as Blender only has mediocre rendering capabilities). Please note that for those of you who do use Blender, don’t think that it is a bad program as it isn’t. But if you have plans on going into the 3D modeling/animation industry you will need to switch programs and its better to do so sooner than later.

EDIT I know this doesn’t have much to do with models itself, but as I am never in any other section of these forums, I felt it made no sense to post elsewhere.

Read full topic
